snippet: The organization helping oversee Syria’s purge said 10 shipments had been exported so far, including all of the country’s deadly sulfur mustard.
abstract: Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons reports that nearly half of Syria’s chemical stockpile for weapons use has now been removed from the war-ravaged country.

byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce contributed reporting from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: The organization helping oversee Syria’s purge said 10 shipments had been exported so far, including all of the country’s deadly sulfur mustard.

headline.main: Gains Reported in Removing Syrian Chemical Supplies
headline.print_headline: Gains Reported in Removing Syrian Chemical Supplies
